content:
The protagonist of “Such Good Work” seeks to vanquish his own demons by helping refugees in Sweden

Such Good Work. By Johannes Lichtman. Simon & Schuster; 304 pages; $26

IN “SUCH Good Work”, Johannes Lichtman’s debut novel, an over-privileged drug addict tries to make sense of his life in a world full of both possibility and hopelessness. It could have been written either as a tortuous piece of auto-fiction (the protagonist shares a number of biographical details with the author) or a series of glib statements on modernity. To Mr Lichtman’s credit, it is neither. He has written a likeable, funny and thoughtful book with an endearingly frustrating central character. Without appearing to try too hard, “Such Good Work” gets to the heart of what it means to have a conscience and attempts—however futile that attempt may be—to use it for the greater good.

Jonas grew up in Los Angeles to an alcoholic father, who left when the boy was 14, and a meditative mother. As an adult, he is dependent on drugs (usually prescribed painkillers, though he isn’t particularly discerning). Though he is high-functioning in his addiction, he has been let go from posts as a creative-writing teacher at a number of liberal-arts colleges across America. As the novel opens, he is being chastised by his head of department for the topic of that week’s assignment: suggesting that his students attend a stranger’s funeral. At a different college the next semester, a poor student Jonas has been earnestly devoting time to turns out to be the worst plagiarist his colleagues have ever encountered.

Ricocheting between despair and AA meetings, yet always furnished with a mordant aperçu, Jonas has one final drugs binge before heading to Malmo in Sweden, “the most drug-free country in the Western world”. There, he enrolls in graduate school and searches for spiritual rehabilitation and a purpose to which he can devote his life. At first, he hopes it can be found in romantic pursuits, and embarks on a relationship with Anja, a German exchange student. When that falters, Jonas focuses his attention on Sweden’s political situation and the thousands of refugees from Syria, Iran and Afghanistan arriving in the country. It is 2015, and Sweden still—if hesitatingly—retains an open border policy.

Teaching the refugees Swedish, Jonas is introduced to a group of teenage boys who have travelled, unaccompanied, from war zones to a supposedly safe haven. Jonas’s warm feelings of beneficence and his self-indulgent dreams of being a “white saviour”—the unpalatable nature of which he fully comprehends—are soon jeopardised. His attempts to counsel Aziz, one young man, through his PTSD are misguided. Then terrorist attacks in Paris lead to a change in Sweden’s attitude towards migrants.

It is gratifying that Mr Lichtman does not endeavour to offer a satisfying answer to these questions of migration, belonging, alienation and addiction. Rather like the solitary characters in “Go, Went, Gone”, Jenny Erpenbeck’s novel about Germany’s refugee crisis, and “Leaving the Atocha Station”, Ben Lerner’s tale of a disaffected young American living in Madrid around the time of the terrorist attack in 2004, Jonas reflects, regrets and moves on.

eg2: What do gambling, sex, heroin and cocaine — and the other things that can addict us — have in common?
赌博、性爱、海洛因和可卡因以及其他能导致我们上瘾的事物，到底有什么共同点？
The things that addict us all produce a very distinctive breakdown in the organization of our preferences, actions and choices.
使我们上瘾的事物都可以在我们的偏好，行为和选择的组织上产生一种特有的破坏。
The  learns to recognize how their thinking, their feelings, and their behaviors lead them into the addictive cycle.
成瘾者通过学习了解他们的想法、感受和行为是如何诱导他们进入了成瘾周期的。

但上瘾并非是一种大脑状态，它指的是行为。

他说：“我认为上瘾这个词有点问题。

For example, allow users to input more biographical info in profiles or give them the option to favorite/rate your blog posts and the contributions of other users.
比如，允许用户 在个人资料中输入更多的传记信息，或者给他们一些选项来为你的博客文章或者其他用户的贡献进行评分。
Doing this can improve your fiction, , and some forms of work writing a great deal.
这样，你就是对你的小说、传记或是其他体裁的文章大有帮助。

他们去的时候，我必将我的网撒在他们身上，我要打下他们，如同空中的鸟。 我必按他们会众所听见的惩罚他们。

尽管如此，这个时机无疑很有利，因为自1998年以来，这是美国总统第一次访问这个国家，引起人们对奥巴马总统初次前往中国的极大兴趣。

Wherefore not; since all the powers of nature call so  for the confession of sin, that these black weeds have sprung up out of a buried heart, to make manifest an unspoken crime?

To begin with, that any glib answer to the question misses the core of the experience – the complex dialectic of being ill, which is a social as well as physical condition.
